posts.post_content: This guy was a staple back in the old days of Magic. It was *so* fun to drop him on turn 1 and listen to your opponent groan if she/he didn't have a bolt or a swords in hand. You could almost always count on gaining card advantage with this guy. The old artwork was cool too.

Posted By: spoonish (7/25/2009 10:29:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I sure do miss the old days. Turn one [dark ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dark ritual) + this guy, turn two [sinkhole](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sinkhole) or [hymn to tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hymn to tourach), turn three [mind twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mind twist)...man, that stuff was fun. Modern M:TG doesn't even compare.  
  
It needs the ritual to be in its full glory, but ol' hippie is still good nonetheless. The old artwork was better though...why are specters just ringwraiths?
posts.html:
I sure do miss the old days. Turn one dark ritual + this guy, turn two sinkhole or hymn to tourach, turn three mind twist...man, that stuff was fun. Modern M:TG doesn't even compare.

It needs the ritual to be in its full glory, but ol' hippie is still good nonetheless. The old artwork was better though...why are specters just ringwraiths?
